pr_title: [Optimize][Delete] Simplify the delete process to make it fast

timeline.bodyText: If begin transaction failed, exception will be thrown. So no need to check here.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: Use a concurrent map is enough
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: use commitAndPublishTransaction() instead, and then afterCommit() can be removed.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: Use GSON serde
timeline.author: morningman

replies.bodyText: There is problem that using GSON read() have to create a new object, but I wish to keep the old object and only use a readField() method.
replies.author: xy720

timeline.bodyText: this logic is wrong.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: You can not write log here, because the transaction may commit fail
timeline.author: morningman

replies.bodyText: I will put it in afterVisible() in interface AbstractTxnStateChangeCallback instead.
replies.author: xy720

timeline.bodyText: isSchemaChaning is useless, just set it to false
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText:
If you put deleteInfo in idToDeleteJob, you need to make sure that the deleteInfo will be cleaned finally, even if any exception is thrown.
So I think you should clear the deleteInfo in finally block.
timeline.author: morningman

replies.bodyText: added a new try finally block surround outside this logic
replies.author: xy720

timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: Add comment for this method.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText:
if  db == null, the state will be left as UN_QUORUM, and then the DeleteHandler will still try to finish the job, which is wrong.
You need to clarify the behavior of this function, such as what the return value is, when an exception is thrown, and whether the thrown exception can be properly handled by the caller.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: Same problem to db==null.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: After the while loop, the job may still failed.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: You should handle this exception, for example, abort the transaction.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: !isSuccess does not mean the transaction is failed, it means the transaction is committed and publish timeout (not VISIBLE yet). So you should not cancel the job, but should tell the user the delete is success but will be taking effect later.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: You can not use the origin OP_FINISH_SYNC_DELETE, because they are different operations.
timeline.author: morningman

replies.bodyText: Now add a new operation OP_FINISH_DELETE
replies.author: xy720

timeline.bodyText: You should also show the delete info from Load, or after we upgrade the Doris, the old delete info can not be seen.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: There will be concurrent issue when visiting tabletDeleteInfoMap from different thread: the report task thread and DeleteHandler thread. So you should use ConcurrentHashMap
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: After changing tabletDeleteInfoMap to ConncurrentHashMap, you should use putIfAbsent to perform the atomic operation here.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText:
This method return boolean, but you never use it.
I think return true means cancel succeed(txn failed), and return false means cancel failed(txn succeed).
And the caller should use this return value to decide whether to return user success or failure.
timeline.author: morningman

replies.bodyText: And if transaction is COMMITTED but not VISIBLE, you should return a transaction id to user, so that user can use that it to check transaction's state.
replies.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: No need db lock here.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText:
QueryStateException should derived from UserException.
Better to just create a QueryState inside the QueryStateException, and here you can just call context.setState(e.getQueryState());. If other people use this exception, he will know how to use it.
timeline.author: morningman

timeline.bodyText: No need to use synchronized here, I think you can just use a ConcurrentSet in TabletDeleteInfo
timeline.author: morningman
